sdk/api/lmsystems-client.title: LmsystemsClient API
sdk/api/lmsystems-client.description: The LMSystems SDK provides two client implementations: LmsystemsClient (async) and SyncLmsystemsClient (sync). Both offer the same functionality with different execution models.

sdk/api/purchased-graph.title: PurchasedGraph API
sdk/api/purchased-graph.description: The PurchasedGraph class provides a way to integrate purchased marketplace graphs into your own LangGraph applications. It implements the PregelProtocol, making it compatible with LangGraph's StateGraph system.

sdk/examples/github-agent.title: GitHub Agent Example
sdk/examples/github-agent.description: This example demonstrates how to use the LMSystems SDK with our GitHub Agent graph, which can analyze GitHub repositories.

sdk/examples/usage-examples.title: Usage Examples
sdk/examples/usage-examples.description: This page provides comprehensive examples of using the LMSystems SDK in different scenarios.

sdk/getting-started/adding-config.title: Adding Configuration to Your Graph
sdk/getting-started/adding-config.description: When selling your graph on our marketplace, you'll need to modify your LangGraph app to accept configuration values that can override environment variables. This enables buyers to use their own API keys while you maintain yours for testing and development.

sdk/getting-started/installation.title: Installation Guide
sdk/getting-started/installation.description: This guide will help you get started with the LMSystems SDK.
